# Typography

Another important part of UI design is typography i.e. how to choose and use fonts in digital products. There is a huge (and growing) pile of materials covering both theoretical and practical aspects of typography all over the internet.

# Courses and books

ðŸ“Œ Google Fonts has recently published quite nice collection of articles on their site Fonts Knowledge:

  • How to choose typefaces
  • How to use fonts
  • Glossary and Terms

ðŸ“Œ Baseline's design course's typography section has also plenty of quality content:

  • Typography basics
  • How to Choose a Font
  • Working With Type
  • Ten Typography Tips
  • How to Combine Fonts

ðŸ“Œ If that's not enough, then try Typography Handbook

ðŸ“Œ And last, but not least â€“ here is a free online coure from Better Web Type

# More

  • LearnUI: Font Size Guidelines - practical tips about how to use font sizes systematically
  • Cortes: Practical Typography Tips to Improve in Product Design, UX, Web, and Graphic Design
  • UXDesign: A practical guide on how to choose and tweak typefaces for your design project
